snippet: France is seeking to inject momentum into an effort to build a viable opposition to hasten the end of the civil war, but the United States has yet to recognize the new alliance as Syrians’ sole representative.
abstract: Syrian authorities order airstrikes close to Turkish border for third consecutive day and criticize French decision to recognize and consider arming newly formed opposition coalition.

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: France is seeking to inject momentum into an effort to build a viable opposition to hasten the end of the civil war, but the United States has yet to recognize the new alliance as Syrians’ sole representative.

headline.seo: Ordering More Airstrikes, Syria Calls French Recognition of Rebels ‘Immoral’
headline.main: Syria Orders More Airstrikes and Calls French Recognition of Rebels ‘Immoral’
headline.print_headline: Syria Orders More Airstrikes and Calls French Recognition of Rebels ‘Immoral’
